alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. Helena; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 8:59AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN ST. HELENA, NORTHWESTERN ST. TAMMANY, NORTHEASTERN LIVINGSTON, TANGIPAHOA AND WESTERN WASHINGTON PARISHES, WALTHALL, PIKE AND SOUTHEASTERN AMITE COUNTIES THROUGH 945 AM CST... At 858 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Summit to near Livingston. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Mccomb, Covington, Franklinton, Greensburg, Amite, Ponchatoula, Amite City, Magnolia, Kentwood, Livingston, Summit, Independence, Tylertown, Roseland, Albany, Folsom, Springfield, Osyka, and Montpelier. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 21 and 59. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 24 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in New Orleans.
